intro: Silphium nudicaule, commonly known as the slender silphium, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its tall, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer, typically from July to September. Silphium nudicaule is adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and prairies. It is considered a rare and endangered species due to habitat loss and over-collection.
